alert.note: Alert for Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 12:49PM CST until February 08 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Hempstead, Lafayette and Miller. In northeast Texas, Bowie, Cass and Marion. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. Current trends indicate that around a half an inch per hour is falling under the current line of thunderstorms moving through this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Atlanta, Wake Village, Nash, Hooks, Linden, Queen City, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Fouke, Brightstar, Ravanna, Bivins, Genoa, Mandeville, Kildare, Fairview and Leary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
